crossdevice_def: "Our concept of ubiquitous instrumental interaction separates interaction from the rest of the application [3]. An interaction instrument mediates interaction between a user and the objects of interest. For example, users can designate objects with a pointing instrument, move them with a drag-and-drop instrument, and change their color with a color selection instrument. Instruments are independent of the objects they operate on: they need only know that the object implements a given protocol, such as selecting, changing position, or setting a color. Multiple instruments can be used in parallel. Instruments can also be embodied in portable devices---for example, a smartphone used as a laser pointer. In this case, the instrument runs on the device and interacts with objects located on other surfaces"
